name: ReaderPage

simplifiedSchema.fullComment: This is what we need on the page level. There are many subtleties to it, but this is the core

schema.fullComment: If true, the current path represents a folder, not a file.
Project relative file path that is actually used
In case the type is a folder, this is either the only file in that folder, or the README, or the index.*, or blank.

Our version of frontmatter is a bit simpler than regular frontmatter

Not sure if this is a good idea, but it keeps it simple for our OS

all values parse in a similar way to csv

make sure that you use quotes if you want to store a string with commas, because commas in a parameter indicate that it is a string array

NB: string arrays are comma separated values, where you can put values with special characters in between quotes
schema.nb: string arrays are comma separated values, where you can put values with special characters in between quotes
